reviews.text: I have been staying at IATM ever since its opening and have slept in king rooms, signature suites, and, once, in one of the "honeymoon" suites. The inn was one of my favorite Arkansas destination hotels, nearly on the level of the Capital Hotel in Little Rock. Alas, that is no longer the case. Rooms could stand a fresh coat of paint, missing pulls on scuffed armoires could be replaced, carpets could handle a good cleaning. No longer are there fish in the mill's pond; no longer is there a leisurely wine and cheese reception in the comfortable lobby area. In fact, IATM is now a step below a standard room in a new Comfort Inn. Hopefully, the owners will spend necessary time and money to return the inn to its glory-days condition. Until then, what a shame.
reviews.title: Sadly, not what it used to be

reviews.text: We drove in just past the water wheel, went into the lobby, and were greeted by a knowledgeable and friendly lady at the concierge. The hotel is quaint yet luxurious, cozy yet spacious. Our room was beautiful, and the food at the restaurant was delectable. What lovely ambience! The warm banana cake with pecan malt ice cream is unforgettable!
reviews.title: Timeless Beauty and Serenity

reviews.text: We splurged this time and stayed in a suite. The room was nice but the rate was more than double what we paid for a king room and it wasn't much different from what we had previously. Staff was very nice and accommodated any request that we made. Breakfast was adequate, nice for a continental meal.
reviews.title: Great Place But Not Quite As Good As Before. . . .

reviews.text: The wine social has been moved to the restaurant. Patrons are given a free drink each and are served at the bar. It is a rather cold, uncomfortable environment, although the drink was good. Happy hour in the hotel was a comfortable experience which allowed guest to visit with each other and the staff. Too bad this format was changed.
reviews.title: Great hotel and wonderful staff!!

reviews.text: My husband and I stay here at least once a month for business travel. The rooms are beautiful, the beds are the best we have ever had in a hotel! The staff is very friendly and accommodating. I love the layout of the rooms. The bath robes are soooo comfortable!
reviews.title: Wonderful last minute overnight

reviews.text: Reasonably priced. Beautiful grounds. Enjoyed the complimentary drink served at the Inn's restaurant. Hallway had a little bit of a musty smell but it was not noticeable in the room. The room was well appointed. Upon return to the hotel later that evening I found parking to be a bit problematic - there was not a spot at all close to the entrance to the room. Service at the front desk was excellent.
reviews.title: Pleasant enough stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for my boyfriends birthday , very clean staff was wonderful .We both love finding out the history of a place and the staff could not have been more courteous and knowledgeable about the Mill and the area. We loved getting up the next morning and wondering thru the garden area and feeding the fish in the Koi pond. We will definitely stay at the Mill again!
reviews.title: Nice, Clean and Friendly

reviews.text: We stayed while dropping off our daughter to go to Univ of AR Fayetteville. Our stay was lovely! The whole experience was wonderful - making reservation on the phone, changing from 3 to 2 nights over the phone a few days before arrival, check in (Brad is SO friendly!), the room was really nice, the grounds are beautiful with lots of little waterfalls.
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was very good, much better than chain hotel's free breakfasts! Healthy food and better selection. I was very happy about this!
reviews.title: Not Like It Used To Be

reviews.text: My only hesitation w/ recommending it is that everyone else will book it and it'll be harder for me to stay!
reviews.title: Wonderful Service

reviews.text: Booked the same day. Got a king bed ! Clean. Feather pillows. Robes. Granite counter tops in bathroom. Modern faucet. Great furniture in rooms. Flat screen tv. $98. We missed the free breakfast because we slept sooo good. Great rooms!
reviews.title: Rustic meets Modern

reviews.text: I enjoyed our stay SO much! Room was beautiful and clean, grounds had amazing flowers and the staff was very kind and helpful. On top of that, there were some great extras like wine and cheese on the deck in the evening and a great breakfast with a lot more than just basic hotel food. We'll be back!
reviews.title: A wonderful anniversary!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is so great, we totally love it! The hotel staff was super friendly from the start, very inviting and the hotel lobby smelled like cookies and coffee-I was sold from the minute we walked in. The staff greet you like family or friends and the hotel is so cute, with the restored mill and the landscaping is so beautiful -picture worthy in it's self.
reviews.title: Super Great Place to stay the night

reviews.text: The room was great with extra comfy bed and pillows and very soft towels. It also came with white cotton bath robes-unheard of in a room of this price! It had all the stuff you want like frig., microwave, and even a DVD player, which is nice because there is a redbox right down the street at the convenience store. Watch a movie while you kick back at night for a buck. The coffee in the rooms was good, but the coffee in the breakfast was so excellent-fresh ground, also they had fresh fruit including strawberries, blueberries, etc. and hot/cold cereal, meats/eggs, really nice.
reviews.title: what a lovely surprise

reviews.text: They have a restaurant right behind the office and rooms and offer a complimentary first drink. We really enjoyed this stay and would highly recommend it!
reviews.title: Charming place to stay in Northwest Arkansas

reviews.text: This is my second visit to the Inn at the Mill. Stayed here on business for two nights. The location is a block to two away from the highway which helps with the quietness of the property. My favorite parts of the stay are the personable front desk staff and the James at the Mill Restaurant. Overall, a great place for business or leisure travelers. Breakfast is included and it reminded me of a European B&B (meats, cheeses, coffee, pastry, cereal, fruit). I'm thinking of bringing my family along the next time I am in town so they can also experience the Inn at the Mill.
reviews.title: Feel of a Great B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent two nights here in early October. The location twenty minutes south of Crystal Bridges Museum and ten minutes north of Fayetteville suited our purposes perfectly. Easy access to the interstate but very quiet. Excellent service, satisfactory room, good breakfast, nice grounds and gardens, commendable incorporation of historic mill structure into the compound. Reasonably priced, too. James at the Mill restaurant (moderate upscale) is quite good.
reviews.title: Met all expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all, this Inn is in Johnson, AR, on Greathouse Springs Road. This is our second vist, and it will not be the last. Celebrating our anniversary, we once again found this Inn to be so laid back and refreshing, yet very very modern. Such beautiful and spacious rooms, with sitting space, a desk, and ev erything you want. The staff is small, so they get to know you. The beautiful waterway with the sound of rushing water cascading down the hillside to the mill pond is relaxing. You must try James at the Mill restaurant on site. Exquisite dining, creative menu's, and unbelievable service. Happy hour at the bar overlooking the kitchen is an experience in watching gormet dinners being prepared. Thanks to all the people who made our anniversary special. We will be back.
reviews.title: Wonderful Place

reviews.text: This is one of the top places I've ever stayed at! The front desk people were the nicest and most helpful ever (Larry was one front desk people, very knowledgeable). One of the women (embarrassingly I can't remember her name) let me borrow her umbrella while I was at the Chile Pepper race, that my son was racing in, when it was pouring rain. I had already checked out too.
reviews.title: Wow, wow, wow!

reviews.text: They upgraded me to a larger room since I am a Choice Hotels Diamond member. Their restaurant food and drinks were outstanding (free drink and they also had happy hour). The bed was very comfortable with many amenities (jacuzzi, bathrobe, fancy soaps and shampoos, balcony and spacious room and of course a tv). The breakfast had many choices in all areas. The grounds were beautiful landscaped with water features and paths.
reviews.title: Nice hotel
